info.title: distribute API
info.description:
API Gateway for distribute. Handles authentication, proxies to internal services, and exposes the public REST API.

## Authentication

All authenticated endpoints require a Bearer token in the `Authorization` header.

There are two key types, each with different identity resolution behavior:

### 1. User key (`mcpf_*`)

Issued per-user via `POST /v1/api-keys`. The key already carries the user's internal org UUID — no extra headers needed.

```
Authorization: Bearer mcpf_abc123...
```

### 2. App key (`mcpf_app_*`)

Issued when an app registers via `POST /v1/apps/register`. The key identifies the **app**, not a user or org. To access endpoints that require org/user context (campaigns, keys, activity, etc.), you must also send two identity headers:

| Header | Description | Example |
|--------|-------------|---------|
| `x-org-id` | External organization ID (e.g. Clerk org ID) | `org_2xyz...` |
| `x-user-id` | External user ID (e.g. Clerk user ID) | `user_2abc...` |

```
Authorization: Bearer mcpf_app_abc123...
x-org-id: org_2xyzABC
x-user-id: user_2abcDEF
```

The API service resolves these external IDs to internal UUIDs via `client-service`. Both headers are **optional** — if omitted, the request proceeds without org/user context, which is fine for endpoints that only need app-level auth (e.g. `GET /v1/me`). But endpoints that require org context (e.g. `GET /v1/campaigns`) will return `400 Organization context required`.

### Error codes

| Code | Meaning |
|------|---------|
| 401 | Missing or invalid Bearer token |
| 400 | Org context required but `x-org-id` header not provided (app key only) |
| 401 | User identity required but `x-user-id` header not provided (app key only) |
| 502 | Identity resolution failed (client-service unreachable) |

bearerAuth.description:
Bearer token authentication. Two key types are supported:

- **User key** (`mcpf_usr_*`): carries app, org, and user context. No extra headers needed. Recommended for API/MCP access.
- **App key** (`mcpf_app_*`): identifies the app only (server-to-server). To access endpoints that require org/user context, also send `x-org-id` and `x-user-id` headers with your external IDs (e.g. Clerk IDs). The API resolves them to internal UUIDs via client-service.

See the top-level API description for full details and examples.

apiKey.description: API key (only returned on first creation — save it)

name.description: Unique app name (lowercase, alphanumeric with hyphens)

workflowName.description: Workflow name (e.g. 'sales-email-cold-outreach-sienna'). Determines which execution pipeline to use.

targetAudience.description: Plain text description of who to target (e.g. 'CTOs at SaaS startups with 10-50 employees in the US')

targetOutcome.description: What you want to achieve (e.g. 'Book sales demos', 'Recruit community ambassadors')

valueForTarget.description: What the target audience gains from responding

urgency.description: Time-based constraint that motivates action now (e.g. 'Recruitment closes in 30 days', 'Price doubles after March 1st')

scarcity.description: Supply-based constraint on availability (e.g. 'Only 10 spots available worldwide', 'Limited to 50 participants')

riskReversal.description: Guarantee or safety net that removes risk for the prospect (e.g. 'Free trial for 2 weeks, no commitment', 'Phone screening call before any obligation')

socialProof.description: Evidence of credibility and traction (e.g. 'Backed by 60 sponsors including X, Y, Z', '500+ companies already onboarded')

maxLeads.description: Maximum number of leads to contact

campaignIds.description: Array of campaign IDs to fetch stats for

scope.description: Key scope: 'app' for app-level key (no org/user needed). Omit for org-level BYOK.

name.description: Human-readable name for the API key

sourceRefId.description: Reference ID in the source system

byokApiKey.description: BYOK API key for AI provider

skipCache.description: Skip cached results and force re-scrape

url.description: Brand website URL to extract a sales profile from

skipCache.description: Skip cached results and force re-extraction

humanId.description: Human ID if styled after an expert

signature.description: SHA-256 hash of the canonical DAG

signatureName.description: Human-readable name for this DAG variant

action.description: Whether the workflow was created or updated

humanId.description: Human ID if styled after an expert
Human ID from human-service. Required when type is 'human'.

brandId.description: Brand ID from brand-service. Required when type is 'brand'.

name.description: Display name of the human or brand (e.g. 'Hormozi', 'My Brand')

WorkflowStyle.description: Optional style configuration. When provided, the workflow is generated in the style of an industry expert or brand.

description.description: Natural language description of the desired workflow. Be specific about steps, services, and data flow.

expectedInputs.description: Expected flow_input field names (e.g. campaignId, email)

hints.description: Optional hints to guide DAG generation

systemPrompt.description: System prompt for the AI assistant

mcpServerUrl.description: MCP server URL for tool calling

mcpKeyName.description: MCP key name for auth resolution

reload_amount_cents.description: Auto-reload amount in cents (for payg mode)

success_url.description: URL to redirect after successful payment

eventType.description: Event type determining which template to use (e.g. 'webinar_welcome', 'j_minus_1')

recipientEmail.description: Direct recipient email (fallback when no userId on the key)

productId.description: Product/instance ID for product-scoped dedup (e.g. webinar ID)

messageStream.description: Postmark message stream ID, e.g. "outbound" or "broadcast"

currency.description: Currency for amountOff (required if amountOff is set)

orgCreated.description: Whether a new org was created

userCreated.description: Whether a new user was created

externalOrgId.description: External organization ID (e.g. Clerk org ID)

externalUserId.description: External user ID — use a generated UUID for anonymous users

get.description: Returns API name, version, and docs URL
Returns service health status
Returns debug info about external service configuration
Returns the OpenAPI 3.0 JSON spec for this service

post.description: Register a new app and receive an API key. Idempotent: returns existing appId if already registered. The API key is only shown on first creation.

get.description: Returns performance leaderboard data including brands, workflows, and hero stats. Requires authentication.

schema.description: Filter by application ID (opt-in, omit to return all)

parameters.description: Filter by application ID (opt-in, omit to return all)

x-org-id
parameters.description: External organization ID (e.g. Clerk org ID `org_2xyz...`). Required when using an app key (`mcpf_app_*`) on endpoints that need org context. Ignored when using a user key (`mcpf_*`).

parameters.name: x-user-id
parameters.description: External user ID (e.g. Clerk user ID `user_2abc...`). Required when using an app key (`mcpf_app_*`) on endpoints that need user context. Ignored when using a user key (`mcpf_*`).
